Yoruba: Lọ́dún tó kọjá ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù méjìlélọ́gbọ́n ló kópa nínú ìdíje yìí, ṣùgbọ́n lọ́dún yìí ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù ogójì ni yóò kópa nínú ìdíje náà.

English: “The new clubs are those relegated from the Nigeria Professional Football League (NPFL).
Yoruba: Àwọn ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù tuntun ti yóò dara pọ̀ mọ́ ìdíje náà, ni ó wá láti inú ìdíje Nigeria Professional Football League (NPFL).

English: Some were promoted from the Nationwide League One (NLO) and some of them bought other clubs’ slots to join the league.
Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni àwọn mìíràn gbà ìgbéga láti inú ìdíje Nationwide League One (NLO), tí àwọn mìíràn sì ra ààyè ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù mìíràn láti dara pọ̀ mọ́ ìdíje ọ̀hún.

English: “The new clubs include Kada Football Club, Malumfashi FC, Bimo FC, Real Stars FC, Stores FC and Rovers FC.
Yoruba: Àwọn ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù mìíràn ọ̀hún ni: Kada Football Club, Malumfashi FC, Bimo FC, Real Stars FC, Stores FC àti Rovers FC.

English: He said the competition’s organising body had agreed on the introduction of an abridged league system for the season.
Yoruba: "Ó fikún un pé, ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń sàkóso ìdíje náà gbà láti jẹ́ kí àwọn ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù tuntun darapọ̀ mọ́ ìdíje ọ̀hún, ní pàápàá jùlọ láti mú òfin mìíràn, èyí tí yóò dá ìdíje ọ̀hún dúró gbàrà tí ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé bá bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀.

English: “We introduced the abridged system in order not to be interrupted by the Russia 2018 World Cup matches.
Yoruba: A ṣe ìfilọ́lẹ̀ òfin tuntun náà láti fi àyè sílẹ̀ fún ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé  2018tí yóò wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè Russia.

English: “We will go on break as soon as the World Cup starts, and we will resume immediately after the global football event.
Yoruba: A ó gba ìsinmi ráńpẹ́ ní kété tí ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé bá bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀, tí a ó sì bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ padà tí ìdíje náà bá wá sí ìparí.

English: --- Real Madrid rally to pip Bayern Munich 2-1
Yoruba: --- Real Madrid fàgbà han Bayern pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò méjì sóókan.

English: --- Super Eagles will be ready for England friendly - Mikel
Yoruba: --- Super Eagles yóò gbáradì ní kíkún fún ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ pẹ̀lú England - Mikel

English: The Captain of the Super Eagles, Mikel Obi says the Super Eagles will be at their best for the prestige international friendly match against England at Wembley Stadium in London on June 2.
Yoruba: Balógun ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Super Eagles, Mikel Obi sọ pé, Super Eagles gbáradì sílẹ̀ fún ìfẹsẹ̀wọnse ọlọ́rẹ̀ẹ́jọ̀rẹ́ tí ikọ̀ ọ̀hún yóò gbá pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀-èdè England, èyí tí yóò wáyé ní pápá ìṣeré Wembley nílùú London, lọ́jọ́ kejì inú oṣù kẹfà ọdún tí a wà yii.

English: “There will be no option for us other than to give our best with the FIFA World Cup fast approaching.
Yoruba: Kò sí ọ̀nà mìíràn fún wa ju pé, kí á gbáradì ní kíkún sílẹ̀ fún ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé náà tó ti ń súnmọ́ etílé.

English: The match comes up only two weeks before our first match at the FIFA World Cup.
Yoruba: Ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọlọ́rẹ̀ẹ́jọ̀rẹ́ ọ̀hún yóò wáyé ní ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì sí ìdíje FIFA bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé ọ̀hún.

English: Nigeria take on Croatia in their first match at the 21st FIFA World Cup finals at the Kaliningrad Stadium on June 16.
Yoruba: Nàìjííríà yóò wàákò pẹ̀lú Croatia nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ àkọ́kọ́ ìdíje àgbááyé ọ̀hún, ní pápá ìṣeré Kaliningrad lọ́jọ́ kẹrìndínlógún oṣù kẹfà ọdún tí a wà yìí.

English: In their other Group D matches, they will then face Iceland at Volgograd on June 22.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ìfigagbága pẹ̀lú Iceland yóò wáyé ní pápá ìṣeré Volgograd lọ́jọ́ kejìlélógún inú oṣù kẹ̀fà.

English: Meanwhile, tickets for the England/Nigeria match are still selling, with the lowest ticket going for 35 pounds.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ìwé pélébé ìwòran fún ìfẹsèwọnsẹ̀ tí yóò wáyé láàrín England àti Nàìjíría ti wà lọ́jà fún títà báyìí, tí ìye rẹ̀ jẹ́ pounds márùndínlógójì (35 pounds) owó ilẹ̀ òkèrè.

English: --- ‘Uzoho will shine at the world cup’ – Rohr assures
Yoruba: --- Rohr Uzoho yóò fakọyọ nínú ìdije bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé.

English: Super Eagles coach Gernot Rohr is upbeat that young goalkeeper Francis Uzoho will come good at the World Cup in Russia as first choice.
Yoruba: Akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà ikọ̀ Super Eagles, Gernot Rohr fọwọ́ sọ̀yà pé, aṣọ́lé tuntun fún ikọ̀ Super Eagles Francis Uzoho yóò kópa dáradára nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé tó ń bọ̀ lọ́nà lórílẹ̀-èdè Russia.

English: “I don’t think goalkeeping is the weak link in my team after we lost Carl Ikeme to sickness, we had what seemed like a goalkeeping crisis but Ikechukwu Ezenwa did well in the qualifiers but we kept looking for options.
Yoruba: Rohr sọ pé, Mi ò lérò pé, ìṣòro aṣọ́lé ni ikọ̀ Super Eagles ní láti ìgbà tí Carl Ikeme ti wà nípò àìsàn, a lérò pé ìṣòro aṣọ́lé ni a ní, ṣùgbọ́n Ikechukwu Ezenwa ṣe dáradára nínú àwọn ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ìpegedé tí a gbá, pàpà síbẹ̀ a sì ń wà asọ́lé mìíràn.

English: “I don’t believe he will get stage fright playing against the likes of Messi and other big names in Russia, because after playing against the likes of Lewandowski of Poland, Aguero and Di Maria of Argentina, I am optimistic that he would rise to the occasion in Russia.”
Yoruba: Mi ò lérò pé Uzoho yóò ní ìṣòro kankan láti kojú irú agbábọ́ọ̀lù bi Messi àti àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù jàǹkànjàǹkàn mìíràn, nítorí pé lẹ́yìn tí ó kojú Lewandowski, Aguero àti Di Maria, Ó ṣe dáradára, èyí ni ó fún mi ní ìdánilójú pé yóò fakọyọ nínú ìdíje náà.

English: On his 35-man team list for the World cup, Rohr stated that he would submit the lost by May 4 to the NFF.
Yoruba: "Ẹ̀wẹ̀, Rohr fikún ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ pé, òun yóò ṣètò àpapọ̀ àgbábọ́ọ̀lù márùndínlógójì tí yóò kópa nínú ìdíje náà fún àjọ NFF lọ́jọ́ kẹrin oṣù karùn-ún ọdún tí a wà yìí.

English: --- ‘End of an era ‘- Arsene Wenger to step down from Arsenal
Yoruba: --- Òpin sáà - Arsene Wenger yóò fi ipò rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá Arsenal.

English: Long-serving coach of Arsenal football club, Arsene Wenger, has announced he will step down at the end of the season, ending a near 22-year reign at the club.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn ọdún mejìlélógún ti akọnímọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Arsenal, Arsene Wenger ti ń tukọ̀ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù ọ̀hún, Wenger ti kéde báyìí láti fi ikọ̀ náà sílẹ̀ lópin sáà tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ yìí.

English: “I am grateful for having had the privilege to serve the club for so many memorable years.
Yoruba: Mo dúpẹ́ lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ fún àǹfààní láti sin ikọ̀ yìí fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún.

English: “I managed the club with full commitment and integrity.
Yoruba: Mo tukọ̀ yìí tọkàn-tọkàn pẹ̀lú oyè kíkún.

English: “I want to thank the staff, the players, the Directors and the fans who make this club so special.
Yoruba: Mo fé dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́, àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù, olùdarí gbogbo, àti pàápàá jùlọ àwọn olólùfẹ́ ikọ̀ yìí, fún àtìlẹyìn àti ìfẹ́ wọn tí ò lẹ́gbẹ̀ tí wọ́n fi hàn sí mi láti ìgbà tí mo ti ń tukọ̀ ikọ̀ yìí.

English: “I urge our fans to stand behind the team to finish on a high.
Yoruba: Mo rọ àwọn olólùfẹ́ wa láti túbọ̀ dúró ṣinṣin pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ yìí láti pàri sí ibi tí ó lápẹrẹ lórí tábìlì ní sáà yìí.

English: “To all the lovers, take care of the values of the club.
Yoruba: Sí àwọn olólùfẹ́ wa, ẹ ri dájú láti ṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn ohun ìní wa gbogbo.

English: My love and support for ever.”
Yoruba: Ifẹ́ mi àti àtìlẹyìn mi fún ikọ̀ yìí, yóò wà títí ayérayé.

English: --- Antonio Conte commended Victor Moses.
Yoruba: --- Antonio Conte gbóríyìn fún Victor Moses.

English: Chelsea chief coach Antonio Conte has commended one of his players who is a Nigerian and a special player in the team of the Nigeria Super Eagles, Victor Moses.
Yoruba: Akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Chelsea, Antonio Conte ti gbósùbà káreláí fún agbábọ́ọ̀lù rẹ̀ ọmọ bíbí àti agbábọ́ọ̀lù kan gbòógì nínú ikọ̀ Super Eagles Nàìjíríà, Victor Moses.

English: Moses scoered a goal which helped Chelsea football team to win the competition with Burnley football team at Turf Moor stadium.
Yoruba: Moses gbá àmì ayò kan wọlè, tí ó sì ṣẹ̀ ìrànwọ́ àmì-ayò kan láti ran ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Chelsea lọ́wọ́ láti jáwé olúborí nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Burnley ní pápá ìṣeré Turf Moor.

English: Though Ashley Barnes retured a goal to make the match one goal to two (1-2), but it was unfortunate.
Yoruba: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé, Ashley Barnes dá àmì-ayò kan padà, láti sọ èsì ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún di àmì ayò kan sí méji (1-2), ṣùgbọ́n omi pọ̀ ju ọkà lọ.

English: Accoding to Antonio Conte, ‘we played very well today and we deserve the three goals, most especially Moses tried so much after he had scored a goal and helped for another  goal.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Antonio Conte ṣe sọ,"A kópa ribiribi lónìí, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni, a ní ẹ̀tó sí àmì mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta ọ̀hún, ní pàápàá jùlọ, Moses ṣe gudugudu méje ọ̀hún yààyà mẹ́fa, léyìn tí ó gbá àmì-ayò kan wọlé tó sì tún ṣe ìrànwọ́ àmì-ayò kan.

English: Winning in two in two consecutive games will help us a great deal to play very well in our forth coming competition.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀," jí jáwé olúborí nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ méji léra yóò ṣe ìrànwọ́ ńlá fún wa láti kópa dáradára nínú àwọn ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ wa mìíràn tó ń bọ̀ lọ́nà.

English: Now Chelsea will face Southampton in the second league of the FA finals on Sunday.
Yoruba: "Ní báyìí, Chelsea yóò lọ kojú Southampton nínú ìfigagbága ìpele kejì sí àṣekágbá ìdíje FA lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.

English: For other games in English language.
Yoruba: Fún àwọn eré ìdárayá mìíràn ní èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì kan síi.

English: --- MFM kicked out of CAFCC by Djoliba
Yoruba: --- Djoliba já MFM kúrò nínú ìdíje CAFCC.

English: Nigeria’s MFM FC have been knocked out of the CAF Confederation Cup (CAFCC), despite playing out a 0-0 draw against Djoliba of Mali in the second leg of their play-off tie.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù MFM FC tílù Èkó, lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà ti jáde kúrò nínú ìdíje CAF Confederation Cup (CAFCC), bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé, èsì ìfigagbága ẹsẹ̀ kejì náà parí sí ọ̀mì ayò (0-0) pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Djoliba torílẹ̀-èdè Mali.

English: The match played at the Modibo Keita Stadium in Bamako saw the hosts edged out the Olukoya Boys 1-0 on aggregate.
Yoruba: Ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún wáyé ní pápá ìṣeré Modibo Keita ní Bamako, lẹ́yìn tí ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Djoliba ti fàgbà han MFC tẹ́lẹ̀ nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ àkọ́kọ́ pẹ̀lú àmì ayò kan sóódo(1-0).

English: Oumar Kida, Siaka Bagayoko and Mohammed Cisse also wasted clear-cut opportunities for the hosts in the entertaining encounter.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, oríṣiríṣi àǹfààní ni Oumar Kida, Siaka Bagayoko àti Mohammed Cisse pàdánù láti tún gbá àmì ayò wọlé.

English: Nigeria now has only one representative, Enyimba FC of Aba, left in the competition following the ouster of Plateau United and Akwa United.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Enyimba FC tìlú Abá nìkan ló kù tí yóò máa sojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà nínú ìdíje náà, lẹ́yìn tí ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Plateau United àti Akwa United ti já kúrò ṣaájú.

English: Plateau United lost 4-0 against Algeria’s USM Alger on Tuesday, bowing out 5-2 on aggregate.
Yoruba: Plateau United pàdánù pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò mẹ́rin sóódo (4-0) sọ́wọ́ USM Alger torílẹ̀-èdè Algeria lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun, tí àpapọ̀ èsì ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún sì parí sí àmì ayò márùn-ún sí méji (5-2).

English: Also, Akwa United beat Al Hilal of 3-1 in Uyo earlier on Wednesday but exited the competition on away goals rule having lost the first leg 2-0.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́pé wọ́n jaẃé olúborí pẹ̀lú àmì ayò mẹ́ta sóókan nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ẹsẹ̀ kejì pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Al Hilal, ṣùgbọ́n ikọ̀ náà já kúrò nínú ìdíje ọ̀hún látàrí èsì ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ àkọ́kọ́, eléyìí tí ó parí sí àmì ayò méjì sóódo.

English: --- Kwara SWAN congratulates Olarinoye
Yoruba: --- SWAN ẹ̀ka ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara ki Ọlárìnóyè kú oríire.

English: The Kwara State Council of the Sports Writers Association of Nigeria (SWAN) has congratulated the erstwhile team doctor of Nigeria’s national Under-17 team, Dr Ayodeji Olarinoye, over his appointment as a Doping Control Officer (DCO) by the World Football Governing Body, FIFA.
Yoruba: Ẹgbẹ́ tó ń rí sí ṣíṣe akọọ́lẹ̀ ọrọ eré ìdárayá ní Nàìjííríà, Sports Writers Association of Nigeria (SWAN), ti panupọ̀ pẹ̀lú ẹbí, ọ̀rẹ́, ará láti ki Dókítà Ayọ̀dèjì Ọlárìnóyè, kú oríire ìyànsípò tuntun gẹ́gẹ́ bí alákòóso ẹ̀tò ìlera àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù fún àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lágbàáyé FIFA Doping Control Officer (DCO), ẹni tí ó jẹ́ dókítà tí ó ń ṣàkóso ìlera ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù ọ̀dọ́ Nàìjííríà tọ́jọ́ orí wọn kòju mẹ́tadínlógún lọ (Nigeria national Under-17 team).

English: The SWAN in a statement issued in Ilorin by its Assistant Secretary, Abdulrosheed Okiki said the appointment is a well-deserved going by his track record of achievements in previous national assignments.
Yoruba: SWAN sọ nínú ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ èyí tí igbákejì akọ̀wé ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀hún, Abdulrosheed Okiki gbé jáde nílùú Ìlọrin pé, ìyànsípò dókítà náà níí ṣe pẹ̀lú iṣẹ́ takuntakun tí ó ń gbése àti àṣeyọrí rẹ̀ nínú ojúṣe tórílẹ̀-èdè yàn fún un.

English: The SWAN noted that Dr Ayodeji Olarinoye is the first Nigerian to achieve the feat and prayed that he succeed in the onerous task of championing anti-doping in football at the international level.
Yoruba: SWAN fikún-un pe, ìyànsípò dókítà Ayọ̀dèjì Ọlárìnóyè ni ó jẹ́ àkọ́kọ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà tí yóò ṣe irú àṣeyọrí báyìí, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni wọ́n gbàdúrà pé Ọlọ́run yóò fún un ní ọgbọ́n àti òye láti kojú àwọn ìṣòro lọ́lọ́kan-ò-jọ̀kan bí ó bá ṣe ń wá sí iwájú rẹ̀.

English: The SWAN recalled that Dr Olarinoye made his name as the team doctor for the 2013 and 2015 Golden Eaglets teams that won the FIFA Under-seventeen World Cup.
Yoruba: Lára àṣeyọrí Dókítà Ọlárìnóyè tí SWAN tó kà sí, ni iṣẹ́ takuntakun rẹ̀ tí ó ṣe nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé tàwọn ọ̀dọ́ náà, tọdún 2013 àti 2015, èyí tí ikọ̀ Golden Eaglets gba ife-ẹ̀yẹ ìdíje ọ̀hún wálé.

English: Dr Olarinoye is the son of retired civil servant and former Head of International Department of the NFF, Dr Steve Olarinoye.
Yoruba: Dókítà Ọlárìnóyè jẹ́ ọmọ bíbí adarí ẹ̀ka àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù ilẹ̀-òkèrè nínú àjọ NFF tẹ́lẹ̀rí, Dókítà Steve Ọlárìnóyè.

English: --- FIFA rankings: Nigeria now ranked 47th
Yoruba: --- Ipo ̀atẹ FIFA: Nàìjííríạ̀ bọ́ sí ipò mẹ́tàdínláàdọ́ta lágbàáyé.

English: Nigeria has moved five places up, now 47th in the world and sixth in Africa with 635 points in the April FIFA/Coca Cola rankings released.
Yoruba: Nínú ipò àtẹ àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lágbàáyé FIFA, tí ó ṣẹ̀sẹ̀ jáde, Nàìjííríà bọ́ sí ipò mẹ́tàdínláàdọ́ta lágbàáyé, tí wọ́n sì di ipò kẹfà mú nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà pẹ̀lú àpapọ̀ àmì Òjìlélẹ́gbẹ̀ta-dín-márùn-ún tí ikọ̀ ọ̀hún ní.

English: In the previous rankings, Nigeria was on 52nd position with 609 points.
Yoruba: Nínú ipò àtẹ kẹyiǹ tí ó jáde, Nàìjííríà wà ní ipò méjílélógójì lágbàáyé pẹ̀lú àmì ẹgbẹ̀wa-ó-lé mẹ́sàn-án lórí tábìlì.

English: Meanwhile, Tunisia is the highest ranked African team on 14th place with Senegal and DR Congo on 28 and 38 positions respectively.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, orílẹ̀-èdè Tunisia ni ó wà lókè jùlọ ṣaájú orílẹ̀-èdè mìíràn nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà, lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n di ipò kẹrìnlá mú lágbàáyé, tí Senegal àti DR Congo sì di ipò méjídínlọ́gbọ̀n àti ipò méjídínlógójì ní ìtẹ̀léǹtẹ̀lé.

English: Germany still retains first place with Brazil following closely while Belgium who was fifth in the March rankings is now third.
Yoruba: Germany sì dúro lókè téńté tábìlì ipò àtẹ lágbàáyé, tí Brazil sì tẹ̀lé wọn, Belgium bọ́ sí ipò kẹta láti ipò karùn-ún tí wọ́n wà tẹ́lẹ̀.

English: Nigeria’s foes at the 2018 World Cup Argentina, Croatia and Iceland have plummeted from their current positions, with the South Americans now fifth, Croatia 18th and the Nordic country 22nd.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí Nàìjííríà yóò máa wàákò pẹ̀lú nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé  2018 tó ń bọ̀ lọ́nà, Argentina, Croatia àti Iceland wà ní ipò karùn-ún, ipò kejìdínlógún àti ipò kejìlélógún ní ìtẹ̀lẹ́ǹtẹ̀lé.

English: The next world ranking will be published  on 17 May, 2018.
Yoruba: Ipò àtẹ́ àjọ FIFA mìíràn yóò tún jáde lọ́jọ́ kẹtàdínlógún oṣù karùn-ún ọdún tí a wà yìí.

English: --- Real Madrid and Bayern Munich are moving to the semi-finals of UEFA
Yoruba: --- Real Madrid áti Bayern pegedé sípele kejì àṣekágbá ìdíje UEFA.

English: --- Jos stadium to be ready in May
Yoruba: --- Pápá ìṣeré Jos yóò parí fún lílò nínú oṣù karùn-ún.

English: The Jos ultra-modern stadium will be ready for continental matches in May, Mr Plamen Iliev, Director, BCC Tropical Nig. Ltd, handlers of the project, said in Jos.
Yoruba: Adarí àgbà Ilé-iṣẹ́ ìkọ́lé, BCC Tropical Nig. Ltd,  ọ̀gbẹ́ni Plamen Iliev, tó ń kọ́ pápá ìṣeré ultra-modern stadium nílùú Jos sọ pé, iṣẹ́ yóò parí lórí pápá ìṣeré ọ̀hún nínú oṣù karùn-ún ọdún tí a wà yìí.

English: Iliev told Plateau governor Simon Lalong, who paid an unscheduled visit to the site, that materials needed to meet Confederation of African Football (CAF) specifications had been acquired and were being installed.
Yoruba: Iliev sọ ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún fún gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau, Simon Lalong, lásìkò àbẹ̀wò rẹ̀ sí pápá ìṣeré náà, Ó sì fikún un pé gbogbo ohun èlò ni ìpèsè rẹ̀ ti wà nílẹ̀ báyìí láti kọ́ pápá ìṣeré ọ̀hún ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìlànà tí àjọ CAF fi sílẹ̀.

English: Reigning Premier League Champions, Plateau United, one of Nigeria’s four representatives in CAF continental competitions, have been banned from playing their home matches in Jos because of the state of the stadium.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Pleateau United tí wọ́n wà lórí òkè téńté tábìlì ìdíje NPFL báyìí, ni àjọ CAF ti fòfin dè láti má se gbá ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ kankan lórí pápá náà, látàrí ipò tí ò bójú mu tí papa ìṣeré ọ̀hún wà báyìí, àyàfi bí wọ́n bá ṣàtúnṣe sí pápá ìṣeré náà, ní èyí tí iṣẹ́ sì ti ń lọ lórí rẹ̀ báyìí.

English: Supporters of the Jos side have blamed the soccer outfit’s early exit from the CAF Champions League on the fact that it played its home matches in Kano, far away from home.
Yoruba: Àwọn olólùfẹ́ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Pleateau united ti bu ẹnu àtẹ́ lu bí ikọ̀ náà ṣe pàdánu ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ẹsẹ̀ kejì wọn nínú ìdíje CAF Champions League látàrí pápá ìṣeré ìpínlẹ̀ Kano tí ikọ̀ ọ̀hún ti lọ gbá ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà, èyí tí ó jìnà sí ilé wọn.

English: Iliev, who took governor Simon Lalong round the stadium, said that the dressing room, the seats, the scoreboards and other requirements of CAF would be ready in May.
Yoruba: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Iliev, tí ìsàkóso bí àtúnṣe yóò se bá pápá ìṣeré ọ̀hún wà lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀, ṣàlàyé fún gómìnà Simon Lalong pé, ìyàrá ìtúnraṣe (dressing room), àwọn àga ìjókòó (the seats), àwọn iyàrá ìgbọ̀nsẹ̀, balùwè àti bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ ni gbogbo rẹ̀ yóò ti wà ní títún ṣe kí ó tó di inú oṣù karùn-ún ọ̀hún.

English: In a brief remark, Lalong said that government had desired to meet all the conditions before the commencement of the NPFL and CAF competitions.
Yoruba: Gómìnà Simon Lalong, sọ pé ìjọba yóò ri dájú láti mú àtúnṣe bá pápá ìṣeré ọ̀hún gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìlànà tí àjọ NPFL fi sílẹ̀ láti tẹ̀lé ṣaájú kí ìdíje  CAF mìíràn ó tó bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀.

English: --- 5 Cameroonian athletes missing at Commonwealth Games
Yoruba: --- Òǹdíje ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Cameroon márùn-ún sọnù ní Commonwealth Games.

English: Five Cameroonian athletes competing at the Commonwealth Games in Australia have gone missing.
Yoruba: Òǹdíje ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Cameroon márùn-ún tó ń kópa nínú ìdíje Commonwealth Games tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Australia, ni wọn kò rí mọ́ báyìí.

English: The country’s Team Manager, Victor Agbor Nso, said on Tuesday.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí alákòóso ikọ̀ tó ń sojú Cameroon nínú ìdíje náà.

English: Nso told Cameroon state broadcaster CRTV that Weightlifter Olivier Matam and boxers Ndzie Tchoyi and Simplice Fotsala were due to compete on Tuesday but could not be found.
Yoruba: Ògbẹ́ni Victor Agbor Nso, ṣe sọ lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀rọ̀yìn CRTV sọ̀rọ̀ lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun, Nso sọ pé, òǹdíje nínú ìrin gbígbé, Olivier Matam, oluja Ndzie Tchoyi àti Simplice Fotsala ni wọ́n yẹ kí wọ́n figagbága lọjọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun (Tuesday), ṣùgbọ́n tí wọn kò rí wọn.

English: He added that two other weightlifters Aka Angeline Filji and Mikoumba Petit David, had earlier gone missing from the games at the Gold Coast, but did not specify when.
Yoruba: Nso fikún ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ pé, àwọn òǹdíje olùgbé irin mìíràn, tí a mọ̀ sí (weightlifters), Aka Angeline Filji ati Mikoumba Petit David, ni wọn kò rí ní Gold Coast.

English: He explained that Australian police were informed about the situation.
Yoruba: Sụ̀gbọ́n, ní báyìí ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún ti wà lọ́wọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá Australia.

English: He said "we have officially informed our hierarchy back home: the Ministry of Sports and the president of the National Olympic Committee of Cameroon".
Yoruba: Nso tẹnu mọ́ ọn pé, "A ti fi ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún tó àwọn tọ́rọ̀ọ́ kàn gbangban tí ó rán wa wábí létí, tí àjọ tó ń rí sí eré ìdárayá, tí ó fi mọ́ ààrẹ ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń rí sí ṣísàkóso ìdíje Olympic ní Cameroon (National Olympic Committee of Cameroon)".

English: We have also laid formal complaint to the Australian police.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ni a ti ṣe ohun tí ó tọ́, láti fi ọ̀rọ̀ náà tó àwọn agbófinró létí ti Australia.

English: It is not the first time Cameroonian athletes disappeared at major sporting event.
Yoruba: "Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ìròyìn fi múlẹ̀ pé, èyí kìí ṣe ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí àwọn òǹdíje aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Cameroon yóò sọnù nínú irúfẹ́ ìdíje báyìí.

English: In 2012, five male boxers, a female footballer and a male swimmer absconded from the London Olympic village.
Yoruba: Lọ́dún 2012, òǹdíje márùn-ún nínú ìfigagbága ìjà (five male boxers), agbábọ́ọ̀lù obìnrin kan àti olụ̀wẹ̀ ọkùnrin kan ni wọ́n di àwátì nílùú London.

English: --- Jurgen Klopp-Idije Champions League has to do with the result.
Yoruba: --- Jurgen Klopp-Ìdíje Champions League ní ń ṣe pẹ̀lú èsì.

English: Liverpool chief coach, Jurgen Klopp has commended his team after defeatin g their counterpart Manchester City out of the UEFA champions League with two goals to one (2-1), to qualify for the semi finals of the game.
Yoruba: Akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Liverpool, Jurgen Klopp ti gbósùbà káreláí fún ikọ̀ rẹ̀ lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n já ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù akẹẹgbẹ́ wọn Manchester City kúrò nínú ìdíje Uefa Champions League pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò méjì sóókan (2-1), láti pegedé sípele kejì sí àṣekágbá ìdíje ọ̀hún.

English: After Liverpool won in the first match with three goals to nothing (3-0) at Anfield stadium.
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tí Liverpool jáwé olúborí nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ àkọ́kọ́ pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò mẹ́ta sóódo (3-0) ní pápá ìṣeré Anfield.

English: Though City scored a goal immediately the match started, but the stuggle was much after Liverpool retured two gaol immediately the second half of the game started at Etihad stadium.
Yoruba: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé, City gbá àmì-ayò kínní wọlé ní kété tí ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n omi pọ̀ ju ọkà lọ, lẹ́yìn tí Liverpool dá àmì-ayò méjì padà gbàrà tí sáà kejì ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ ní pápá ìṣeré Etihad Stadium.

English: According to Klopp, ‘I’m not happy for the way we played in the first half of the game.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Klopp ṣe sọ,"Inú mí ò dùn rárá fún bí a ṣe kópa ní sáà kínní ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún.

English: We did not do very well, but I spoke with my football team to make up their mind and I am so happy that we won at the end! UEFA Champion League has nothing to do with how good the football team or how well they played but the result of the two halves in the tunament.
Yoruba: A ò ṣe dáradára rárá, ṣùgbọ́n Mo bá àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù mi sọ̀rọ̀ láti pa ọkàn pọ̀ sójú kan, inú mí sì dùn pé a jáwé olúborí níkẹyìn!"Ìdíje Uefa Champions League kò nííṣe pẹ̀lú bí ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù ṣe dára sí tàbí ṣe kópa si, bí kì í bá ṣe èsì ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ tí ó bá wáyé lẹ́yìn sáà ìfigagbága méjèèjì,

English: Now Real Madrid football team will host Juventus at the Santiago stadium, also Bayern Munich will host Sevila at Alliance Arena Stadium.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Real madrid yóò gbàlejò Juventus ni pápá ìṣeré Santiago, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni, Bayern Munich yóò gbàlejò Sevila ní pápá ìṣeré Alliance Arena.

English: --- Powerlifter Oyema sets world record, Ezuruike, Ndidi win gold
Yoruba: --- Oyema fakọ yọ nínú ìwe-ìtàn, Ezuruike, Ndidi gbà àmì-ẹ̀yẹ góòlù.

English: Nigeria’s gold rush at the ongoing commonwealth games is well and truly on with the para powerlifters leading the charge.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ Nàìjííríà ń kópa ribiribi nínú ìdíje Commonwealth games tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Australia.

English: Para powerlifter Esther Oyema set a new world record by winning a gold medal in the lightweight category.
Yoruba: Esther Oyema fìtàn balẹ̀ lágbàáyé nínú eré ìdárayá irin gbígbé (Para powerlifter), Ó fìtàn balẹ̀ lẹ́yìn tí ó gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ góòlù ṣaájú àwọn akẹẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tí wọ́n jọ kópa.

English: Oyema set a new world record for the women’s under 50kg class with a 141.6kg lift, edging compatriot Lucy Ejike, who claimed the silver medal with a lift of 131.4kg.
Yoruba: Oyema gbé ìkún irin tí ó lé lọ́kànlélógóje Kílò (141.6kg), ṣaájú akẹẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ Lucy Ejike, tí ó gbé ìkùn irin tí ó lé lọ́kànléláàádóje Kílò (131.4kg).

English: In the men’s lightweight category Roland Ezuruike led Nigeria to a one-two finish by claiming the gold medal with a lift of 224.3kg.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, nínú ẹ̀ka irin gbígbé tàwọn ọkùnrin, Roland Ezuruike tukọ̀ Nàìjííríà gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ góòlù, lẹ́yìn tí ó gbé ìkún irin ìwọ̀n tí ó lé lókòólénígba-ó-lé-mẹ́rin Kílò (224.3kg).

English: Fellow Nigerian Paul Kehinde picked up the silver with a 219.9kg lift.
Yoruba: Akẹẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀, Paul Kẹ́hìndé gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ ipò kẹta tí ń ṣe, silver lẹ́yìn tí ó gbé ìkún irin ìwọ̀n tí ó le lókòólénígbadínkan Kílò (219.9kg).

English: In the heavyweight category, Ndidi Nwosu won the gold medal to take Nigeria’s medal haul to four gold, four silver medals.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ní ẹ̀ka irin wúwo gbígbé, Ndidi Nwosu gba àmì-ẹyẹ góòlù láti sọ àpapọ̀ àmì-ẹyẹ ikọ̀ Nàìjííríà di mẹ́jọ, góòlù mẹ́rin àti Silver mẹ́rin lápapọ̀.

English: --- Harry Kane: I hope to catch up with Salah
Yoruba: --- Harry Kane: Ìrètí wà pé màá bá Salah láìpẹ́.

English: Tottenham Hotspur striker Harry Kane remains hopeful of overhauling Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah in the race for the 2017/2018 English Premier League’s Golden Boot award.
Yoruba: Agbábọ́ọ̀lù ọwọ́ iwájú fún ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Tottenham Hotspur, Harry Kane ní ìrètí pé láìpẹ́ láìjìnà òun yóò ṣaájú akẹẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tó ń kópa fún ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Liverpool FC, Mohamed Salah nínú ìdíje dupò agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí yóò gba bọ́ọ̀lù ṣágbọ̀n jùlọ (Golden Boot award) nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù ilé Gẹ̀ẹ́sí (English Premier League) ti sáà 2017/2018 tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ yìí.

English: But the EPL forward is also focused on helping Spurs finish the season strongly.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ní kane tún ń gbérò láti ran ikọ̀ àgbábọ́ọ̀lù rẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ láti parí ìdíje sáà EPL tọdún yìí sípò tí ó dára lórí tábìlì, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni.

English: Kane is bidding to end the campaign as the division’s top scorer for the third time in a row.
Yoruba: Kane ń gbèrò láti parí ìdíje sáà yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí ó gbá bọ́ọ̀lù ságbọ̀n jùlọ fún ìgbà kẹta léra wọn.

English: “I still believe I can,” Kane told British media. “Whatever happens, there are still games to go. I’ve got to focus on my game.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Kane ṣe sọ lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀, Mo ní ìgbàgbọ́ pé mo ṣì lè ṣe é, tí mo bá le pa ọkàn pọ̀ nínú àwọn ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ tí ó kù.

English: Spurs next face Manchester City in the league on Saturday, before taking on Manchester United in an FA Cup semi-final on April 21.
Yoruba: Spurs yóò máa wàákò pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Manchester City nínú ìdíje EPL lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, oṣù kẹrin, kí wọn ó tó kojú ikọ̀ Manchester United nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ipele kejì sí àṣekágbá ìdíje FA Cup.

English: --- quarter final of the UEFA Champions League.
Yoruba: --- Ìfigagbága ipele kẹta sí àṣekágbá ìdíje UEFA Champions League.

English: --- Ahmed Musa, Moses Simon join DW sports management
Yoruba: --- Ahmed Musa, Moses Simon dara pọ̀ mọ́ ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń ṣàkóso DW sports.

English: Super Eagles duo of Ahmed Musa and Moses Simon have joined sports agency DW sports management.
Yoruba: Ahmed Musa àti akẹẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ Moses Simon ti dara pọ̀ mọ́ ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń ṣàkóso DW sports.

English: This means the sports agency will now be in charge of the players’ transfer negotiation with any club they desire to play for.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí èyí túmọ̀ sí pé, àwọn méjéèjì yóò wà lára ìṣàkóṣo kátàkára ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù bá fẹ́ kópa fún.

English: Veteran winger Musa’s move to the French consortium ends his long association with football agent Tony Harris, who was pivotal Musa’s departure from former Nigerian league champions Kano Pillars to Europe.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, látàrí dídara pọ̀ mọ́ ìgbìmọ̀ iṣàkóso DW sport ọ̀hún, èyí ló fòpin sí ìbáṣepọ̀ Musa àti Tony Harris, lẹ́ni tí ìṣàkóso kátàkárà Ahmed Musa láti dara pọ̀ mọ́ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù lóríṣiríṣi wà lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀, bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ìgbà tí ó kúrò nínú ikọ̀ agbábóòlù Kano Pillars lọ sí ilẹ̀ òkèrè.

English: Moses Simon was also under the agency of Tony Harris.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, Moses Simon wà lábẹ́ ìṣàkóso kátàkára Tony Harris.

English: DW sports management through their twitter handle expressed delight to have both players under their books.
Yoruba: DW sports fi ìdùnnú wọn hàn láti ní ìbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù méjèèjì lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára Twitter wọn.

English: The move brings to seven the number of current Eagles team members now working with DW sports management.
Yoruba: Dídara pọ̀ mọ́ ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún ni yóò di agbábọ́ọ̀lù Super Eagles méje tí yóò máa ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ pẹ̀lú DW sports.

English: The other Nigerian players are Bryan Idowu, Shehu Abdulahi, Henry Onyekuru, Oghenekaro Etebo, and Mikel Agu.
Yoruba: Àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù Super Eagles mìíràn tí wọ́n jọ máa ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ báyìí ni: Bryan Ìdòwú, Shehu Abdulahi, Henry Onyekuru, Oghenekaro Etebo, àti Mikel Agu.

English: ---sixty-four (64) teams for 2018 Mike Okonkwo Cup
Yoruba: --- Ikọ̀ mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta (64) yóò kópa nínú eré ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù Mike Okonkwo.

English: Sixty-four  clubs have been confirmed for the 2018  Bishop Mike Okonkwo Football Championship scheduled to kick off on May 5 this year at the National Stadium in Lagos.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta ni wọ́n ti bọwọ́ lù báyìí pé wọn yóò kópa nínú eré ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù Bishop Mike Okonkwo Football Championship 2018, èyí tí yóò wáyé ní pápá ìṣeré National Stadium tìlú Èkó, bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ karùn-ún oṣù karùn-ún ọdún tí a wà yìí.

English: According to the organisers, the competition will feature eight teams in the  female category, which  has  just been  introduced.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn tí ó ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje náà, ìdíje ọ̀hún ni ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù obìnrin ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ mẹ́jọ yóò kópa nínú rẹ̀ fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́.

English: Chairman of the organising committee for  the competition Malachy Ndubuzor said in a statement that some of the players discovered  would form the basis of the TREM Football Academy.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí alága ìgbìmọ́ tí ó ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje ọ̀hún, ọgbẹ́ni Malachy Ndubuzor, Ó ṣe é lálàyé pé, wọn yóò ríi dájú láti fojú sílẹ̀ mú àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí ó bá fakọyọ nínú ìdíje náà sínú ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù TREM Football Academy.

English: He said the finals of both categories would hold at the Yaba College of Technology  in Lagos on September 1.
Yoruba: Àṣekágbá ìdíje ẹ̀ka méjéèjì, tí ń ṣe ikọ̀ ọkùnrin àti tobìnrin, yóò wáyé ní ilé-ìwé gíga fáfìti onímọ̀-ẹ̀rọ̀ Yaba College of Technology lọ́jọ́ kínní oṣù kẹsàn-án ọdún tí a wà yìí nílùú Èkó.

English: Former Super Eagles player Waheed Akanni, who was a special guest at the draws, commended Bishop Mike Okonkwo for investing in the youths with the annual football championship.
Yoruba: "Agbábọ́ọ̀lù ikọ̀ Super Eagles tẹ́lẹ̀rí, Waheed Akanni, tí ó jẹ́ àlejò pàtàkì lásìkò ìyíkoto ìfigagbága ìdíje ọ̀hún, gbórìyìn púpọ̀ fún Bishop Mike Okonkwo fun akitiyan tó ń kò láti gbé ìdíje ọ̀hún lárugẹ lọ́dọọdún.

English: He said such competitions would discover more youths that are talented football players.
Yoruba: Ò fikún-un pé, ìdíje ọ̀hún yóò ṣe ìrànwọ́ láti ṣàwárí àwọn ọ̀dọ́ tí ò lẹ́bùn eré bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá.

English: --- Europa League: Arsenal, Athletico close in on semis
Yoruba: --- Arsenal, Atletico gbé ẹnu lé ìpele kejì sí àṣekágbá Europa League.

English: Arsenal took a big step towards reaching the Europa League semi-finals after a 4-1 rout of CSKA Moscow and Atletico Madrid did the same with a 2-0 home win over Sporting Lisbon on Thursday.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Arsenal kópa dáradára nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ìpele kẹta sí àṣekágbá ìdíje Europa League, lẹ́yìn tí ó fàgbà han ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù CSKA Moscow pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò mẹ́rin sóókan (4-1) nínú ìfigagbága àkọ́kọ́ ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà, bákan náà sì ni, ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Atletico Madrid kò gbẹ́yìn, lẹ́yìn tí ikọ̀ ọ̀hún náà fàgbà han Sporting Lisbon pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò méjì sóódo (2-0) lọ́jọ́bọ (Thursday).

English: Lazio also stayed on course to progress after an action-packed 4-2 home win over Salzburg in their quarter-final first leg and upstarts RB Leipzig will head to Olympique de Marseille with a 1-0 advantage.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Lazio náà gbo ewúro sójú Salzburg pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò mẹ́rin sí méji (4-2), bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù RB Leipzig fạ̀gbạ̀ han Olympique de Marseille pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò kan sóódo (1-0).

English: Koke scored inside the opening 30 seconds and Antoine Griezmann added the second shortly before half-time.
Yoruba: Koke gbá àmì-ayò kínní wolé níṣẹ̀ẹ́jú péréte tí ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀, kí Antoine Griezmann kó tó fọba lé e kí sáà àkọ́kọ́ ó tó wá sí ìparí.

English: --- 2018 Commonwealth Games: Nigeria defeats Malaysia in table tennis
Yoruba: --- Commonwealth 2018: Nàìjííríà fàgbà han Malaysia nínú ìfigagbága bọ́ọ̀lù orí tábìlì.

English: The Nigerian table tennis team began their campaign in Group 4 of the men’s team event at the 2018 Commonwealth Games in Gold Coast, Australia on a bright note on Thursday.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù orí tábílì Nàìjííríà ti bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ ìfigagbága wọn nínú ìdíje Commonwealth Games tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Australia.

English: Team Nigeria defeated Malaysia and Belize in their opening two ties on Thursday.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ Nàìjííríà fàgbà han Malaysia àti Belize nínú ìfigagbága àkọ́kọ́ tí ó wáyé lọ́jọ́bọ̀.

English: Olajide Omotayo defeated Chee Feng from Malaysia in three straight sets, recording 13-11, 15-13, 11-7 in his second match of the day.
Yoruba: Olájídé Ọmọ́táyò fàgbà han Chee Feng olùkópa fún Malaysia pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò mẹ́tàlá sí mọ́kànlà (13-11), márùndínlógún sí mẹ́tàlá (15-13), mọ́kànlá sí méje (11-7) ní ìtẹ̀léǹtẹ̀lé.

English: Abiodun will take on Javen Choong from Malaysia and Terry Su from Belize later on Thursday in his remaining games, while Jamiu will face Rohit Pagarani from Belize.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, Abiodun yóò lọ kojú Javen Choong láti Malaysia àti Terry Su láti Belize, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni Jamiu náà yóò lọ kojú Rohit Pagarani láti Belize.

English: The Gold Coast Commonwealth Games will be Nigeria’s 13th since its maiden appearance in 1950.
Yoruba: Ìdíje Commonwealth Games yìí, ni yóò di ìgbạ̀ kẹtàlá tí Nàìjíírìà yóò kọpà nínú rẹ̀ láti ọdún 1950.

English: Team Nigeria will also be seeking to surpass their best performance at the competition, having won a record 37 medals at the 1994 Commonwealth Games in Canada.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ikọ̀ Nàìjííríà yóò máa fojú sọ́nà láti tún fìtàn mìíràn balẹ̀ tí yóò kọjá èyí tí orílẹ̀-èdè ọ̀hún ní tẹ́lẹ̀ nínú irúfẹ̀ ìdíje náà tí ó wáyé lọ́dún 1994 ní Canada, lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ mẹ́tàdínlógójì nínú ìdíje náà.

English: Nigeria won 36 medals (11 Gold, 11 silver and 14 bronze) at the last edition of the Commonwealth Games which was held in Glasgow, Scotland in 2014.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, nínú ìdíje Commonwealth Games tí ó wáyé ní Glasgow, lórílẹ̀-èdè Scotland lọdún 2014, Nàìjííríà gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ mẹ́rìndínlógójì, tí ń ṣe (11 Gold, 11 silver ati 14 bronze).

English: The 2018 Commonwealth Games which got underway with a colourful opening ceremony on Wednesday is expected to end on April 15.
Yoruba: Ní ìparí, ìdíje Commonwealth 2018 ọ̀hún tí ó bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ lọ́jọ́rú, ní ìrètí wà pé yóò parí lọ́jọ́ karùndínlógún oṣù kẹrin ọdún tí a wà yìí.

English: --- Commonwealth: Sally Pearson sad over injury knock-out
Yoruba: --- Sally Pearson: Ìbànújẹ́ ló jẹ́ pé mi ò ní tẹ̀síwájú nínú ìdíje Commonwealth.

English: Australia’s world champion 100m hurdler Sally Pearson has been forced to withdraw from her home Commonwealth Games as she battles a serious Achilles injury that could sideline her for up to a year.
Yoruba: Sally Pearson ọmọbíbí orílẹ̀-èdè Australia, tí ó tún jẹ olùkópa tí ó dára jùlọ lágbàáyé nínú eré sísá hurdles ni kò ní tẹ̀síwájú nínú ìdìjé Commonwealth Games tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ látàrí ìfarapa tí ó ní lẹ́sẹ̀, léyìí tí ó sì mú yébà kíkópa nínú eré-ìdárayá ọ̀hún fún ọ̀dún kan.

English: --- Commonwealth Games: Dalung urges Team Nigeria to compete fairly
Yoruba: --- Dalung rọ ikọ̀ Nàìjííríà láti lọ fakọyọ nínú ìdíje Commonwealth.

English: The Minister of Youths and Sports, Solomon Dalung, on Tuesday advised Nigerian athletes at the XXI Commonwealth Games in Gold Coast, Australia to compete fairly without tarnishing the country’s image.
Yoruba: Mínísítà tó ń rí sí eré-ìdárayá àti ìdàgbàsóke àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ní Nàìjììríà, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Solomon Dalung, ti rọ ikọ̀ Nàìjííríà tí yóò lọ sojú nínú onírúurú ìdíje eré-ìdárayá Commonwealth Games tí yóò wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè Australia láti kópa dáradára.

English: Nneka Ikem-Anibeze, the Special Assistant on Media to Dalung, quoted the minister in a statement as giving the advice while addressing Team Nigeria athletes and officials in Gold Coast.
Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ àgbélẹ̀kọ̀ rẹ̀, èyí tí àmúgbálẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ pàtàkì sí mínísítà ọ̀hún ní ẹ̀ka ìròyìn àti ọ̀rọ̀ ìfitóniléti ṣe sọ, ogbeni Nneka Ikem-Anibeze, Ó ní, mínísítà gbà wọ́n níyànjú láti lọ sojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà dáradára.

English: He addressed the athletes immediately after the Welcome Ceremony organised by the organisers of the Games to officially welcome Team Nigeria to the Games Village.
Yoruba: Ò sọ̀rọ̀ náà di mímọ̀ ní kété tí wọ́n parí ayẹyẹ ìṣíṣọ lójú eégún láti bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ ìdíje ọ̀hún, tí wọ́n sì kéde ikọ̀ tí yóò máa sojú Nàìjííríà.

English: I see you are all to be in high spirits and it shows that you have prepared for the competition.
Yoruba: Mo ríi pé, ẹ ti ń fojú sọ́nà láti bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ síní ń kópa, léyìí tí ó fara hàn pé, ẹ ti gbáradì lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ fún ìdíje yìí.

English: It is the President’s wish, that at the end of our sojourn here, the name of Nigeria will be greater.
Yoruba: Ni fikún un pé, ìrètí ààrẹ Buhari ni láti ríi pé, orúkọ Nàìjííríà gòkè àgbà, kí orílẹ̀-èdè ọ̀hún sì fakọyọ nínú ìdíje náà.

English: The ceremony saw the athletes being entertained with a dance troupe from the Munujali tribe.
Yoruba: Ayẹyẹ ìṣíṣọ lójú eégún ọ̀hún ni ó wáyé láti ṣe ìkíni káàbọ̀ àwọn ikọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè kọ̀ọ̀kan tí yóò máa kópa nínú ìdíje ọ̀hún pẹ̀lú orin, ìlù àti ijó látọwọ́ ẹgbẹ́ oníjó Munujali.

English: Each gold medalist will receive $5,000, silver will attract $3,000 while bronze medalists will get $2,000 each.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, olùkópa tí ó bá gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ góòlù (Gold) yóò láǹfààní sí ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbààta owó dọ́là ($5,000), àmì-ẹ̀yẹ̀ ipò kejì (Silver) yóò gba ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbàajì owó dọ́là ($3,000), bẹ́ẹ̀ sìni àmì-ẹ̀yẹ ipò kẹta (bronze) yóò gba ẹgbàá owó dọ́là ($2,000).

English: Also at the Games village to encourage the athletes were the past and present Presidents of the Nigeria Olympic Committee (NOC), Sani Ndanusa and Habu Gumel respectively, as well as the Nigerian Ambassador to Australia, Bello Husseini.
Yoruba: Lára àwọn ènìyàn jàǹkànjàǹkàn tí ó tún yẹ́ ayẹyẹ ìdíje ọ̀hún sí la ti rí aṣojú Nàìjííríà sórílẹ̀-èdè Australia, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Bello Husseini , bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ààrẹ tẹ́lerí àti ààrẹ tí ó wà lórí àléfà báyìí ti ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń rí sí ìdíje Olympic ní Nàìjííríà Nigeria Olympic Committee (NOC), náà kò gbẹ́yìn, Sani Ndanusa àti Habu Gumel.

English: The opening ceremony of the XXI Commonwealth Games holds on Wednesday at the Carrara Stadium in Gold Coast from 7 p.m.
Yoruba: Ayẹyẹ láti bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ ìdíje XXI Commonwealth Games náà yóò wáyé láago méje ọjọ́rùú, ní pápá ìṣeré Carrara ní Gold Coast, Australia.

English: --- Cristiano Ronaldo thanks all the Juventus fans
Yoruba: --- Cristiano Ronaldo dúpé lọ́wọ́ àwọn olólùfẹ́ Juventus.

English: --- The NPFL match will come up today
Yoruba: --- Ìfẹsẹ̀wọ̀nṣẹ̀ ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá NPFL tí yóò wáyé lónìí.

English: --- West Brom and Alan Pardew part ways ‘by mutual consent’
Yoruba: --- West Brom àti Alan Pardew fẹnu kò láti fòpin sí ìbaṣepọ̀ wọn.

English: Pardew was only appointed four months ago to improve West Brom’s standing on the Premier League (EPL) table.
Yoruba: Pardew ni ikọ̀ ọ̀hún gbà ní oṣù mẹ́rin sẹ́yìn ní ìrètí pé yóò mú àyípadà ọ̀tun dé bá ikọ̀ náà lórí tábìlì ìdíje (EPL), ṣùgbọ́n omi pọ̀ ju ọkà lọ.
